name: Mary Jane Draw
description:
Introduction

The Class 4 rating is for the anchor-building requirement, as two of the anchors are deadmen in the watercourse.

  • Trailhead: 38.12051,-108.85757
  • Approach Breakdown: 38.12329,-108.84551
  • Road: 38.12637,-108.84192
  • Head of Canyon: 38.12963,-108.84505

Approach

From the Trailhead, hike east cross-country for about 500 feet past a small butte and steep hillside strewn with white rocks. Head north up the wide ravine to the Breakdown in the caprock. This breakdown is an easy scramble to gain the top layer of rock. Once on top of the mesa, head due north for about 1/2 mile to a dirt road. Go left on the dirt road to the Head of the Canyon.

Descent

After about 1/4 mile of pleasant creek-walking, an obvious drop is reached. This is best set up as a 2-stage rappel in order to facilitate the rope-pull. The anchor is a deadman on the right side of a sand-filled pothole and the rappel drops 60 feet into a hanging pothole with a large chockstone blocking the exit. The second stage of the rappel is done by re-rigging and rappelling off this chockstone, which drops 90 feet to the floor. All of the passengers can be sent down from the top anchor on a 150-foot rappel, but the rope pull does not seem possible without the last person doing it in two stages. Before the final rappel, several downclimbs, one through a rabbit hole, and one down a long crack on the left are encountered. The final rappel is off a deadman anchor and drops 60 feet, in front of two pools, the lower one in the shape of a heart. The rest of the canyon can be downclimbed.

==Exit= Boulder-hop down the drainage down until it flattens out and you should be able to see the cars.
